channel.title: Handling cutscenes?
channel.description:
I know this is something that could be put in server help, but my reason behind it is different then getting just the help.
When you enter a runescape cutscene, the screen typically fades out to black, then shows (sometimes the player) a distant area (where you end up going during the quest) and probably some enemies. I found something for PI, that can pan over the loaded map area, which isn't much (Like 60 squares in each direction?). That won't help if you're standing in varrock square and want to show East Ardy.
The point of this topic:
How would you go about handling fading screens to black, and loading new maps for a cutscene.

item.title: Handling cutscenes?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:23, topic:517783”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=636048.msg4292348#msg4292348 date=1367544787]
Arham, what’s the cutscene ‘feel’?
[/quote]
Idk how to describe it :/. Its something to do with the camera. You can do effects with it.[/quote]
You can shake it and make it point different directions, I see that in rs quests all the time

Read full topic

item.title: Handling cutscenes?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:19, topic:517783”][quote author=Lin link=topic=636048.msg4289318#msg4289318 date=1366931260]

Try searching through ZeroFreeze’s posts. He was the first person I can remember who implemented cutscenes and I’m fairly sure he released the code.
[/quote]I believe Primadude wrote a tutorial/system for them as well, but those posts are long-gone.

After a lot of digging I managed to find that tutorial (It was deleted and placed in a section I have no access to, but can see on his profile). I’m not even sure why it was deleted, but here it is:

http://pastebin.com/wkjkPxaW

I assume that’s the tutorial you’re talking about anyway.[/quote]
Many tutorials have been written for that. But still, it’s a good find.

Just 1 out of the 3 mysteries for cutscenes right there found.

Other 2:

[ul][li]Making it have that cutscene ‘feel’.[/li]
[li]Adjusting setting to make the cutscenes run properly (requires alot of events).[/li][/ul]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/help/240422-packet-list.html

Has a pretty large packet ID dump, didn’t see it when i looked through it, but your best bet is to browse in the client class for the packet handling, and trying figuring it out for yourself, getting a fresh deob is prob, your best bet for finding it.

item.title: Handling cutscenes?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:6, topic:517783”]Wouldn’t you also need a method to reset the camera?
Edit: Isn’t it like sendFrame35?[/quote]
Yes I have packet 35 used too.

	public void sendFrame35(int i1, int i2, int i3, int i4)

[quote=“tyb97, post:7, topic:517783”]Incorrectly named, but packet 35 is actually used to shake the camera.

http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:Camera_shake

Consult the RSWiki for information about the packets, it’s your 1st best place to find what you’re looking for. The 2nd best is google, I’ve seen some packet info dumps on R-S, just id’s no data, but you can figure that out on your own.[/quote]

To be honest, 11/10 I forget that it exists.

Read full topic

item.title: Handling cutscenes?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:6, topic:517783”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=636048.msg4288285#msg4288285 date=1366755811]

the player is teleported to the area you’re showing
you can have them anywhere in the region
i havn’t messed with cutscenes but i’m pretty sure the camera goes off local coordinates
as in like you do x:10 y:10 and it’ll go diagonally north east from your current position

The player is always teleported to the local region?

Packets.

I couldn’t have guessed otherwise.

public void sendFrame177(int x, int y, int height, int speed, int angle) {

[/quote]

Wouldn’t you also need a method to reset the camera?
Edit: Isn’t it like sendFrame35?[/quote]
Incorrectly named, but packet 35 is actually used to shake the camera.

http://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317:Camera_shake

Consult the RSWiki for information about the packets, it’s your 1st best place to find what you’re looking for. The 2nd best is google, I’ve seen some packet info dumps on R-S, just id’s no data, but you can figure that out on your own.

Read full topic

I couldn’t have guessed otherwise.

public void sendFrame177(int x, int y, int height, int speed, int angle) { [/quote]

Wouldn’t you also need a method to reset the camera?
Edit: Isn’t it like sendFrame35?
